title: Disconnected from PVP server in lobby and Champ select
body: I'm disconnecting from the lobby and anywhere not in the game. This always happens and lasts for like 30 seconds. It is very detrimental from my playing experience as it hits in champ select as well. It also doesn't allow me to talk to friends or be invited into game and is frustrating. It happens every like minute or whatever.

replies.body:
Yes, i've tried 'ipconfig /flushdns' on the command prompt and nothing. 
What is IPv6? And also I've tried disabling firewall and nothing.

IPv6 is an advanced form of communication that networks use. Right now (2015), however, the majority of networks still use IPv4 to communicate, so having IPv6 enabled is often redundant. If you have it enabled, sometimes, the client might try using it to communicate when it should use IPv4, so disabling it might work. The way to disable it changes depending on what OS you are on.

Could you please tell me your OS?

P.S. For future replies, use the "Reply" button so I get notification of it.

Have you tried clearing your DNS cache/refreshing your IP? The instructions are different for what OS you are on. Could you please tell me your OS?

Disabling IPv6 might also work.
